Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Reposition \Re`po*si"tion\ (r[-e]`p[-o]*z[i^]sh"[u^]n), n. [L. repositio.] The act of repositing; a laying up. [1913 Webster]
reposition n : depositing in a warehouse [syn: {repositing}, {storage}, {warehousing}] v 1: change place or direction; "Shift one's position" [syn: {shift}, {dislodge}] 2: place into another position
